note.p: Birth: Eccles, near Manchester, Lancashire, England (29 January 1888)
Education: MA; DSc; Manchester University; Trinity College, Cambridge

Career: Chief Assistant, Royal Observatory, Greenwich (1910-1914); Lecturer, Trinity College, Cambridge (1914-1919); Professor, Manchester University (1919-1924); Chief Professor of Mathematics, Imperial College of Science, London (1924-)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB vol 17 pp 153-155
AssocMaterial: CSAC 11/5/74. Papers deposited in the Bodleian Library, Oxford
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1971 vol 17 pp 53-89, plate, by T G Cowling
References: W H McCrea, 'The Royal Observatory and the Study of Gravitation' in NR 1975-6 vol 30 pp 133-140, plate
D C M, 'The Inauguration of the International Geophysical Year' in NR 1956-57 vol 12 pp 160-162
Anon, 'The Royal Society Antarctic Expedition' in NR 1956-57 vol 12 pp 137-138
